thread.title_full: 'Room' star Jacob Tremblay has sights set on 'Star Wars' | Movies | Entertainmen

author: torontosun.com
title: 'Room' star Jacob Tremblay has sights set on 'Star Wars' | Movies | Entertainmen
text:
Jacob Tremblay is nine years old but he's already a veteran of the acting profession.
Tremblay co-stars with Brie Larson in the movie Room (opening Friday) but his resume includes The Smurfs 2, Gord's Brother and Before I Wake, and he's currently filming The Book of Henry with Naomi Watts and Sarah Silverman. He's also co-starring with Naomi Watts in another movie, the upcoming thriller Shut In, due next year.
Based on Emma Donoghue's bestselling novel, Room stars Brie Larson as a kidnapping victim and Tremblay as her five-year-old son, the child of her abductor. Their captive lives are lived in a tiny garden shed where Larson's character has created a whole world for her son; the movie is part thriller, part homage to maternal love.
Room won the People's Choice audience award at the Toronto International Film Festival this year; that award is considered an excellent predictor of Oscar success. Both Larson and Tremblay are likely to get acting nominations, and if Tremblay gets a nod in the Best Actor category, he'll be nudging up against a record for youngest-ever nominee that's been on the books for 84 years — tying nine-year-old Jackie Cooper's nomination for the 1931 movie, Skippy.
Tremblay, who was in Toronto during TIFF, has heard the chat about how he might be an Oscar contender for Room, and he's fine with all that, provided no speeches are required.
"But I write speeches sometimes," he adds, "So I might be really good at it."
Tremblay says the itchy long wig he wore for Room was the toughest part of his job.
The best part?
"I like craft services."
He says he never gets bored on movie sets because he has a tablet. He likes going to the movies and playing with Lego.
Tremblay says he has two sisters — one older, one younger — and zero brothers. Both his sisters are also actors.
Asked if he intends to be an actor when he's an adult, Tremblay says, "Yup."
Then he adds, "But if I don't get the chance I'm going to be a Jedi."
Who would he fight for?
"Canada." (Tremblay is from Vancouver)
The young actor patiently explains that his Book of Henry director, Jurassic World’s Colin Trevorrow, will direct Star Wars: Episode IX, due for release in 2019.
Is it possible Trevorrow might find him a Jedi role?
"It's possible. It's really, really possible. It's extremely possible."
Tremblay has lovely manners. We tell him we intend to write that about him.
What else should we write about him?
"I'm awesome. And I'm very much like a Jedi. And I should have a lightsaber."
